courseDescription: Student participation in a professional work experience for which credit will not apply to the degree. Approval for enrollment is determined by Monarch Internship and Co-Op Office. Experience must be related to the student's major or career area of interest, include adequate supervision by a professional, and include at least an average of 8 hours per week.
Technical and Digital Skills: Software proficiency related to career field
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Collaboration with professionals in the field

courseDescription: Student participation in a professional work experience for which credit will not apply to the degree. Approval for enrollment is determined by Monarch Internship and Co-Op Office (MICO). Experience must be related to the student's major or career area of interest, include adequate supervision by a professional, and include at least an average of 8 hours per week.
Technical and Digital Skills: Application of academic knowledge in real-world context

courseDescription: This course is a professional development course for graduate students that will better prepare them for success in graduate school and subsequently in their careers and the academy. It focuses on establishing a multidisciplinary community of scholars, and encouraging joint exploration of the academy and its expectations, socialization and networking, future career paths, and other relevant issues. Students will develop a professional portfolio to integrate learning, document progress along their professional development plan, and showcase their academic and professional achievements.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Establishing a multidisciplinary community of scholars
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Joint exploration of the academy and its expectations
